name: echo
desc: The echo command can output text to the terminal or a file.

-n.name: do not append a newline character to the output
do not append a newline character to the output

>.name: output text to a file (will overwrite existing content)

>>.name: append text to the end of a file

content:
Example

Output text to the terminal:


echo "Hello, world!"

Output text to a file:


echo "Some text" > file.txt

Append text to a file:


echo "More text" >> file.txt

Display the current working directory:


echo $PWD

Display the current username:


echo $USER

Output a variable with text:


name="John"
echo "My name is $name"

Disable the newline character:


echo -n "This text will be printed on the same line"

Enable escape characters:


echo -e "This text contains a tab character:\\tTab"
